page.title: 09WILDEN VILLAGE,STOURPORT
page.content: The Village owes it's survival to {Alfred Baldwin}who owned the steel rolling mill.The{River Stour}was used as both transport and power supply,the horse drawn barges joining the canal at{Platts Wharf.}Between Stourport and Kidderminster at this time existed 17 mills. The river water level was topped up from an enlarged{Wilden Pool}fed by Winter rains. With the decline of water power all has now disappeared apart from the shells of building which today house modern diverse industries,while Wilden Pool now takes it's water from the Stour to top up levels for the fishing season.
